urned.surveyor@... <sunburned.surveyor%40gmail.com><sunburned.surveyo=
r%
> 40gmail.com>> wrote:
> >> > I have a question about the options for ga=
thering and displaying
> >> > supplemental information about test failures.=
 Please allow me to
> >> > illustrate my question with a simple example.
> =
>> >
> >> > I've got a class called Coordinate that represents a point in a=
 3D
> >> > coordinate system. I've overloaded the toString method of this c=
lass
> >> > to write out the X, Y, and Z values of the coordinate in a simp=
le
> >> > String. Now I want to test my toString method using JUnit.
> >> >=

> >> > If the Coordinate.toString test method fails (because the string wa=
s
> >> > not constructed in the correct format) I would like to provide the=

> >> > programmer running the test with a copy of the incorrect string, si=
nce
> >> > it provides valuable clues about what is broken with the method =
under
> >> > test. I typically do this by placing System.err.println statem=
ents in
> >> > my test method. However, I realize that using System.err.pri=
ntln isn't
> >> > the most portable or elegant way to provide this informat=
ion to the
> >> > programmer executing the test.
> >> >
> >> > What I reall=
y want is a GUI that allows the programmer to select a
> >> > failed test f=
rom a list of failed tests, and then to view supplemental
> >> > test data =
I provide him/her.
> >> >
> >> > I was thinking I could do this by completi=
ng the following tasks:
> >> >
> >> > - Implementing the RunListener interf=
ace in JUnit.
> >> > - Create an extension of Exception that could contain =
a HashMap of
> >> > simple parameters and that would be passed to the const=
ructor of a
> >> > Failure object from within a test.
> >> > - Creating Fai=
lure objects in my tests that contain the supplemental
> >> > failrure data=
.
> >> > - Passing these failure objects to my RunListener implementaiton.
=
> >> > - Creating a FailureProcessor class that displays a GUI with the
> >=
> > information in my RunListener implemenation to show the programmer
> >>=
 > executing my tests the supplemental failure data as described above.
> >=
> > (FailureProcessor would be an interface so that you could do different
=
> >> > things with the supplemental failure data, not just show it in a GUI=
.)
> >> >
> >> > Before I begin this work, I wanted to ask if there was a b=
etter way to
> >> > do this. I know I could use a logging framework from wi=
thin my test
> >> > method, but I really want to work within the JUnut fram=
ework, not
> >> > outside of it. I also want a nice little GUI, not a log f=
ile.
> >> >
> >> > How are other programmers handling instances when they w=
ant to display
> >> > supplemental data on failed tests? Does my approach s=
ound reasonable?
> >> >
> >> > The Sunburned Surveyor
